fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the Insight Macro for confluence v.1.5.0 or higher, the New Attribute Picker now shows "Label" as the header of the Label Attribute, while before, it would show the Attribute's Name - e.g. "Name".

This change now breaks other Macros, using the Insight Macro as a source Table (e.g. Chart from Table Macro).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install IMFC v. 1.4 and configure the macro to show the Name Attribute's Column (Name is the object's Label)
 # Upgrade IMFC to v.1.6.5 and refresh the page

h3. Expected Results

The Column 'Name' is still showing as the Header of the Column
h3. Actual Results

'Label' is now the Header of the same column.

 
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

From IMFC's point of view - Edit the Macro Configuration, Un-select "Label" from the top of the Attribute Picker, and select the "Name" Attribute for the Object Type involved.

This, however, will have to take place in any page where the IMFC is present...
fields.summary: IMFC - With the New Attribute Picker (1.5 or higher) 'Label' is replacing the Label Attribute Column Name

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Different order of IQL subclauses in Import object type mapping affects synced results.

If we have 2 IQL subclauses linked by "OR" and one of these is looking objects having inbound / outbound references (inR / outR), the actual result will depend on how we order the subclauses.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make an LDAP import definition
# Create an object type mapping 
# For one object attribute, use IQL object type mapping that is connected with "OR" keyword, and in the subclause coming after "OR", use inbound / outbound reference check. Example:
{code}
 DN IN (${member${0}}) OR object having inR(DN IN (${member${0}}))
{code}
# Synchronize the import

h3. Expected Results
The object type mapping will be fully considered and both subclauses will be affecting the synced results.

h3. Actual Results
Only the first subclause before "OR" will be considered, the second one where inbound / outbound reference is being used, will be ignored. This will result in a partially imported data.

h3. Workaround
Put the second subclause (inbound / outbound reference IQL) on the first place (i.e. switch the order of subclauses):
{code}
object having inR(DN IN (${member${0}})) OR DN IN (${member${0}})
{code}
fields.summary: Different order of IQL subclauses in Import object mapping affects sync results

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 28 Sep 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff | titleBGColor=#deebff | bgColor=#deebff}

Hi everyone,

Thank you for your interest in this issue. 

This has now been resolved with the latest available version of [Statuspage for Jira Service Management|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1216079/statuspage-for-jira-service-management?tab=overview&hosting=datacenter] (0.3.9).

Kind regards,

Jira Service Management, Server & Data Center

{panel}

h3. Issue Summary

The latest available version for [Statuspage for Jira Service Management|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1216079/statuspage-for-jira-service-management] (0.3.8) is not compatible with Jira Core 8.14.2+ and JSM 4.12+ versions, and can cause customer portal pages to break (see [this|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Statuspage+can+break+customer+portal+pages+when+incompatible+with+Jira+Core] KB article for more information

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira Core 8.15.1 + Jira Service Management 4.15.1
 # Install Statuspage for Jira Service Management 0.3.8 and configure alerts for existing portals
# Try creating an issue at a customer portal

h3. Expected Results
The issue form is populated without errors

h3. Actual Results
A *Failed to load resources required to render the feature. Please try refreshing the page* message is displayed.

h3. Workaround
* Refreshing the page addresses this behavior temporarily, though the behavior happens again when accessing a customer portal again
* Disable Statuspage for Jira Service Management 0.3.8 through {{Administration > Manage Apps}}
fields.summary: Statuspage for Jira Service Management is not compatible with Jira 8.14.2+, breaking customer portal pages

h3. Issue Summary
Selecting the objects while using the search icon deselects the previous selection in Jira and the customer portal. 



h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new request on the customer portal and open the object picker window using the search Icon 
# Select 2-3 objects. 
# Search for an object using the search bar
# Select found object
# Now remove the letters typed in the text area and press Enter
# Notice all the selected objects are gone. 

Please find the screen recording explaining the issue  [^Screen Recording 2021-06-21 at 5.47.39 PM.mov] 

h3. Expected Results
All the selection should be persistent 

h3. Actual Results
The selected objects disappear and none of the objects would be selected

h3. Workaround
Do not use the search Icon option. Try to populate the values by typing in the issue creation page.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Choosing Object Type in the *Filter search* fails to be set as the selected option for the parent object type. The advance search works absolutely fine and once we switch back to basic after searching in advanced, it works. This seems to be a UI glitch. It doesn't throw any error in the front end but it doesn't get selected either

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an object Type
# Create a child Object Type and keep the inheritance CheckBox enabled. 
 # Now create one sample child object
# Now go back to the parent object Type and Try to use the Filter Search option in the 
You will not be able to select the Object Type option. (see screenshot_1
# Now click on Advanced and Type an iql like : objectType = "abcdefc" and then switch back to the basic, then it works fine. (See screenshot_2)

h3. Expected Results

We should be able to select the Object Type option in the Filter Search

h3. Actual Results
 It doesn't throw any error in the front end but it doesn't get selected either

h3. Workaround

Click on Advanced and Type an iql like objectType = "abcdefc" and then switch back to the basic, then it works fine. (See screenshot_2)
fields.summary: Object Type in the Filter search doesn't work for Parent Objects when we have inherited Child object types

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When performing searches in the Jira Service Management Help Center, the search events are logged as per this documentation: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/locating-jira-service-management-s-knowledge-base-search-statistics-through-the-database-957977997.html. |https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/locating-jira-service-management-s-knowledge-base-search-statistics-through-the-database-957977997.html]

Searching in the search box "[What do you need help with|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/files/957977997/957977940/2/1537205635237/custmerportal.png]?" logs all fields as expected. 

The search results that come from [Issue creation screens|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/files/957977997/957977939/2/1537205635352/createissue.png] are not logged with the following values in the database: 
 * searchTime
 * searchTerm
 * source

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the create issue page from the Jira Service Management Portal and enter some terms to trigger a JSM knowledgebase search
 # Look up the search statistics as per the steps here [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/locating-jira-service-management-s-knowledge-base-search-statistics-through-the-database-957977997.html] 
 # The values for searchTerm, searchTime and source values are not populated for searches done in the issue creation screen. 

h3. Expected Results

The values for searchTerm, searchTime and source values are populated for all searches
h3. Actual Results

The values for searchTerm, searchTime and source values are not populated for knowledge base searches coming from the issue creation pages.  
h3. Workaround

No current workaround
fields.summary: Performing a search on Jira Service Management create issue field does not log searchTime, source, searchTerm

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

ENCODING WIN-1250 is not correct while exporting the objects.

Affected Version: All 8.x version
Non Affected version: 6.4.13,7.1.4 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an object schema with few objects.
 # Create an attribute with text type.
 # Put a value for the text type attribute with some CZECH words like Angličtina.
 # View the object. It will display the correct value as below 
 !image-2021-06-15-12-08-15-298.png|thumbnail! 
 # Export the objects with the following settings in a CSV: 
 !Insight_-_Jira.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The results should be displayed correctly as below: 
!export__5_.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The CSV results show the weird characters as below: 
 !export__3_.jpg|thumbnail! 


Note: This behavior is repeatable in a browser, but not in command-line tools like curl.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Insight Asset Management has the option to export objects using a format of "User friendly". This allows linked Jira users to be exported as "display name" and not the Jira "user key".

Insight Reports when exporting data as CSV do not have the option to export in "user friendly" format restricting output for linked Jira users to the rather meaningless user key.

Provide the "user friendly" option on all Insight exports including an option to select "username" or "email address" for Jira user references.

Current workaround is adding additional attributes to an Insight Object to contain the Jira user "display name", "username" and/or "email address" and either scripting or manually updating these for each and every Jira user. An onerous and excessive task.

fields.description:
To my knowledge the order of appearance for KB articles in Service Desk/Service Management depends on the age of the articles, usage of buzz words in titles and texts itself as well as incoming/outgoing links. Currently there's no way to influence/change it (apart of the create/edit date).

Let’s assume there’s a Service Desk portal (running on Jira Server or DC) and there’s a bunch of briefing (KB) articles containing service descriptions (in German: “Steckbrief Service XY”). Those articles have been created most recently but shall not appear at the top of the result list within the SD portal. Nonetheless they should be available. 

It would be very helpful to be able to change that manually since the Service Desk's operator may need to decide what articles the customers potentially should read first. For example: 

A customer is searching for WLAN. He's expecting to read an article about how to set up or how to troubleshoot rather than reading service descriptions where the buzz word "WLAN" does occur (which is a lot of times in a lot of articles).

I was wondering if we can influence the order therefore I suggest to implement a solution which enables a project administrator and/or Service Management agent to do so.

As stated in a related suggestion for Cloud (see JSDCLOUD-9639), it is important for us to be able to sort our articles.
fields.summary: Ability to re-order KB articles in Jira Service Desk

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Service Management has two sets of tables: AO_54307E_VIEWPORT and AO_54307E_SERVICEDESK.
 These tables each have their own IDs and Service Management expects them to be the same. If for some reason they fall out of sync, some features will break.
 * Opening a KB (knowledge base) article from the portal works, but from within the request summary doesn't (error of non-existing article shows up)
 * The portal has one ID when navigating through the browser, but another — invalid — ID when requested through REST API.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Integrate JSM with Confluence through App Links
 # Alter AO_54307E_VIEWPORT_ID_seq or AO_54307E_SERVICEDESK_ID_seq so they no longer have the same next values
 # Create a Service Management project with a Confluence KB space
 # Create an article in confluence with the title "HOW TO ACCESS"
 # On the JSM portal, search for "how to access" and click on the article that shows up. It'll open
 # Go back and select a request from the new project
 # On the summary, type "how to access" and click on the article that shows up. I'll say the article doesn't exist.

h3. Expected Results
 # JSM shouldn't allow the sequences to become out of sync

h3. Actual Results
# JSM has a heavy dependency on the sequences being in sync but there's no FK on the database enforcing it.
# REST API starts producing wrong results
# Confluence KB integration doesn't work when queried from the request creation form
## When checking the portal ID of the request creation form in the URL, we can see that the Portal ID is correct:
 !Request_Creation_Form.png|thumbnail! 
## However, when clicking on the KB article URL, we are redirected to a page showing the following error, which is due to the fact that the incorrect Portal ID is used in the KB article URL
{code}
The service project you are trying to view does not exist
{code}
 !KB_Article_IncorrectPortalID.png|thumbnail! 
## If the KB article URL was properly built, it should be using the same portal ID as the one in the request form URL, and the KB should be displayed properly
 !KB_Article_CorrectPortalID.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

No workaround available. To fix this, we must update the sequences so they become synced again and update the ID on AO_54307E_VIEWPORT and its dependencies to match the AO_54307E_SERVICEDESK IDs.

The KB article [Knowledge Base articles fail to open from the request form in Jira Service Management|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Knowledge+Base+articles+fail+to+open+from+the+request+form+in+Jira+Service+Management] provides extra details on this fix.
fields.summary: Jira Service Management knowledge base and REST API functionalities breaks if viewport and servicedesk sequences mismatch

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After uninstalling Jira Service Management, the *jira-email-processor-plugin* is disabled, which causes any further reinstallation of Jira Service Management to fail due to dependency issues. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install a fresh instance of Jira Software 8.13.4 - 8.13.7
 # Install Jira Service Management
 # Uninstall Jira Service Management
 # Reinstall Jira Service Management

h3. Expected Results

Jira Service Management reinstalls successfully
h3. Actual Results

Reinstallation will hang for approximately 5 minutes until a timeout occurs, where Jira Service Management will look like it is installed, but multiple plugins are not enabled and the application is nonfunctional:

!image-2021-06-04-17-01-48-811.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

*Workaround to reinstall JSM, without upgrading JSM:*

1. Uninstall JSM via *Administration >> Applications >> Versions & licenses* using the *Uninstall* button underneath the JSM application
 2. Stop Jira
 3. Run the following SQL query directly against the DB:
{code:java}
DELETE FROM pluginstate WHERE pluginkey = 'com.atlassian.jira.jira-email-processor-plugin';
{code}
4. Physically remove {{$JIRA_HOME/plugins/installed-plugins/jira-email-processor-plugin-x.xx.x.jar}}
 5. Start Jira
 6. Reinstall JSM

*Workaround to reinstall JSM with upgrade to a fixed version (no DB alteration or restart required):*
 # Uninstall existing JSM
 # Install JSM in version 4.5.16+ (LTS), 4.13.8+ (LTS), 4.16.2+ or 4.18.0+ appropriate for your instance
 # Uninstall JSM again
 # Navigate to: *Manage Apps ->* *All apps ->* find *jira-email-processor-plugin ->* click *Enable* button
 # Install JSM again
fields.summary: Jira Service Management cannot be reinstalled and times out after uninstalling

h3. Issue Summary
JSM project permissions now heavily rely on JSM roles. When roles aren't used in permissions, permission errors will be fired. 

In some organizations, admins do not want project admins to manage project permission via the roles. With this limitation in place, it's not possible. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit the permissions scheme of a JSM project by removing the Admin role from the Administer project permission. 
 # Add the jira-administrators group to the permission. 

h3. Expected Results
Jira should not complain. 

h3. Actual Results
When the project page is reloaded, Jira fires permissions errors: 
{quote}This service desk project has configuration problems and may not work as expected
{quote}
An overview of the permissions errors of JSM can be found in [Resolve permission scheme errors in Jira Service Management|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/resolve-permission-scheme-errors-in-jira-service-management-838416389.html].
h3. Workaround
No workaround is available. The roles have to be added back to the permissions scheme.
fields.summary: Allow Service Management projects to use groups and not roles in permissions schemes

fields.description:
When a mailbox has a very large number of email items (on the thousands), the processing of these messages will impact the processing of other mailboxes for other Jira Service Management projects.

It might eventually lead to an error like this:
{code}
2021-05-20 12:34:55,500-0300 ERROR [] Caesium-1-4 anonymous     Messaging Error when MailPullerWorker pulls emails from myaccount@mycompany.com: * BYE Jakarta Mail Exception: java.net.SocketTimeoutException: Read timed out
{code}

In these cases, it would be beneficial for a message to be displayed in the health check, so admins would quickly know this is the problem.

One possibility to implement this would be to log an entry once a mailbox number of messages goes over a threshold (like 1000 unread emails) - then the health check could get this message.

h3. Issue Summary
While creating/updating an object attribute of "confluence" type, unless you type a whole word which matches with one whole word of the page title Insight doesn't show the page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an applink between Jira and confluence
#* If Jira and Confluence doesn't share the same userbase enable anonymous access on confluence page settings (!)
# Add a Confluence attribute to any objecttype
#* It'd be better to select a specific space:
!2021-06-02_17-37-53.png|thumbnail!
# In the specific Confluence page create the following pages:
#* abcdefghijkl page
#* abcdefghijk page
#* abcdefghij page
#* _...you get the idea_ :) 
# Try to create/update an object's "confluence" attribute

h3. Expected Results
* If you type "abc" it should show you a list of pages matching that pattern

h3. Actual Results

* If you have a page called "abc page" searching with the term "abc" will only show this one page
* if you search with the word "page" it finds all the pages
* If you search with the word "pag" (without the e) it doesn't find the pages
!2021-06-02_17-52-39.mp4!

h3. Workaround

* Type at least one matching word to the title of the pages viz., search with "page" and it will find all the pages above
* In the *new object view page* add an wildcard ({{\*}}) at the end of the search keyword viz., "abc*"
** (!) *Note:* This asterisk trick won't work in the object schema view page
 !2021-06-02_18-24-59.png|thumbnail! 
 !2021-06-02_18-30-10.png|thumbnail! 
* (!) Languages such as *German* where the likelihood of really long words is very high and this bug can cause confusion and inability to use this feature effectively. 
* Add a smaller word anywhere in the page title that you'd be comfortable typing in while searching for the page

h3. Issue Summary

Whenever a user is part of the {{jira-administrators}} group, they are not able to view Object Schemas *Roles* tab. Per our [Roles and Permissions|https://documentation.mindville.com/display/INSSERV/Roles+and+Permissions] documentation, the following is stated:
{quote}
Insight is configured to automatically grant the Insight Administrator role to all jira-administrators
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Insight Plugin *8.6.13*
 # Login as a user with Jira administrators permission.
 # Navigate to an Object Schema where the user has no role and attempt to view the *Roles* tab.

h3. Expected Results

Since the user is a Jira administrator, they would also be an Insight Administrator, which grants them the ability to view the data under the *Roles* tab for any Object Schema.

h3. Actual Results

The following error occurs in the UI when accessing the tab:
 !image.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Have a user that has the Insight Manager role grant the same role to the Jira Administrator user so they can modify these roles.

h3. Additional Notes

- Insight before 8.6.12 did not have this behavior. Previously, the schema wouldn't allow Jira Administrators without the necessary roles view this page.
- As of 8.6.13, Jira Administrators can view this page without the necessary permissions.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Insight post-function to increase object attribute value does not work as expected due to a race condition.

In particular, if the object attribute value gets increased at roughly the same time on different tickets' transition:
 * The first transition will execute the post-function and increase the value
 * At roughly the same time, the second transition will execute the post-function and consider old values, and not the new ones made by the first transition.
 * This is reproducible only if we are triggering transitions from two different Jira nodes in DC environment.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new object type (in this example, it's called Sequences)
 # Inside this object type, add two new Integer-type attributes (in this example, we will call them Code 1 and Code 2)
 # Create an object of Sequences object type. Assign some integer values to Code 1 and Code 2 fields
 # Create Insight field that will contain the object reference. Configure the field as follows (here, the field is called Sequence):
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
 # Inside a workflow editor > go to some specific transition > add the following post-functions that will:
 ** Associate specific, newly created object (step 3) with the custom field Sequence
 ** Increase the existing attribute values for Code 1 and Code 2 fields, by 1
 ** Store those new values into Seq 1 and Seq 2 custom fields
 !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail!
 # Publish the workflow
 # Create an issue inside of a project associated with the published workflow > edit Sequence field and select the object from step 3
 # Create another issue inside of a project associated with the published workflow > edit Sequence field and select the object from step
 # In a browser window, on node 1, on the 1st ticket, perform the transition that would call the post-functions and increment the Insight object attribute values
 # At roughly the same same time, in another browser connected to Jira on node 2, on the 2nd ticket, perform the transition that would call the post-functions and increment the Insight object attribute values.

h3. Expected Results

The 2nd transition increments the new Insight attribute values that were saved by the first transition:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

There is some kind of race condition that happens if the Insight attributes values are increased at roughly the same time, from two different nodes. The 2nd transition will not take newly incremented values, but it will increase the original values as the 1st transition:
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Whenever multiple Insight PFs are set in the same transition, and trying to update the same object, you may face this race condition.
As a workaround, you may have a Groovy Condition to the 3rd 4th and consecutive PFs, to delay its execution:
{code:java}
sleep(n);
return true{code}
where n is a value in ms, and should be adjusted (trial and error);
e.g. for the 3rd PF set n=300 and for the 4th, set n=600.

This will result in the 3rd PF executed with a 300ms delay, hence allowing the 1st and 2nd PFs to complete before executing.
h3. Notes
 * This issue is only reproducible on Jira DC environment, that contains at least 2 nodes.
 * *The first and the second concurrent transition must be executed on different Jira nodes!*
fields.summary: Insight post-function to increase object attribute value does not work as expected due to a race condition

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a new request is created on the CP the page loads and sometimes shows fewer SLAs than configured. After I refresh (say 5-10s later) all the configured SLAs are visible.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As a project admin configure several SLAs as viewable on the Customer Portal
 # Log into the CP as a customer and raise a new request

h3. Expected Results
 * The CP displays the newly created request
 * All configured SLAs are displayed on the same page

h3. Actual Results

Sometimes none, sometimes one, sometimes all (configured) SLAs are displayed.
h3. Cause

This is because SLAs are calculated async to issue creation, so upon issue creation there is a chance that not all SLAs have been calculated for the new issue when the response is about to be composed.
h3. Workaround

Refresh the request page
fields.summary: Not all SLAs are visible on the Customer Portal after request creation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Insight automation fails to take action when triggered by any bulk operation viz., Object Import, Bulk Delete etc.

Please review the steps to reproduce to understand the issue better.

This is similar to the bug on bulk delete not triggering an event when there is an IF condition: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-8491 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have Insight automation like
 !Screenshot 2021-05-28 at 2.45.07 PM.png|thumbnail!
 If the condition need not be that long if you are testing a simple condition.
 # Once you have the automation in place, please proceed with importing vulnerability object type using Insight NVD Integration add-on
 # Make sure that the objects that are getting imported have at least one object which matched the 'if condition', so that a Jira ticket gets created as part of automation.

h3. Expected Results

Automation is triggered whenever there is a matching condition found.
h3. Actual Results

Automation gets triggered but the "_then_" action is not taken. We kind of understand why this could be happening.

Few attributes like (affected products, Metrics) are getting updates either after several minutes or hours after the object is created (as part of the import). The attributes are not updated as part of object creation. Since the 'if condition' is triggered only during the create event and not the update event, we are not seeing JIRA tickets created.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Insight Automation does not take action when IF condition is met via bulk create

As a System Admin, I have created Project Groups to add users to specific projects.  I find it to be an easy and efficient way for me to add new users to growing projects as well as to label/identify users as part of a particular team/group/project.

After doing this a while, it appears there are limitations to Groups and may not be a good use since the Project Admin (PA) cannot add users via Groups.  Also the Group shows as a user of the project to the PA in "Project Setting | People" function, however the PA can only see the Group label and user type (developer) but cannot see who is in that Group.  

Can the Group function be expanded so Project Admins can add teammates via Groups and/or see who all is part of that Group to insure the correct people belong?  Any other tips to adding and organizing users without giving Project Admins access to the who Jira system and other peoples projects?  Please advise.

fields.description:
At Deviniti, we'd like to support your Insight fields in our Search criteria provided by My Requests Extension app. Nevertheless, during our investigation, we've learned, that there is a missing endpoint that would allow to get the objects by the customers. Let me describe the use case.
To allow the customers to search by Insight objects, they need to have an access to a related scheme indicated by Jira Administrator in its settings (more information is described here, in step 6. [https://documentation.mindville.com/insight/latest/integration-with-jira-service-desk-33466851.html)]. 
In the documentation ([https://insight-javadoc.riada.io/insight-javadoc-8.6/insight-rest/)] we found that there is a REST API that gives the ability to get Insight objects, however, it doesn't respect scheme settings what means that the customers always receive an empty list of objects. Unfortunately, as the Insight field doesn't provide any API that would the customers to get the objects that way to respect permission indicated by Jira Admin, we'd like to ask if it's possible to ask you for adding such endpoint as it will help us to support your app in ours?
fields.summary: Insight Rest API inquiry

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In an ['Insight Referenced Objects'|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/referenced-insight-custom-field-1044784430.html] custom field, regardless single or multiple, the changes made to the _Reference type_ option is not reflected on the custom field configuration page. 

Administrators had to navigate back 1 page to the configuration summary in order to view the change.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Insight Referenced Objects custom field
# Configure the custom field 
# Make changes to the _Reference type_ option (eg: select any reference) - [^insightcf1.png]
# Save the change
# Note the value of the _Reference type_ option remains to be "All reference types" despite the 'Successful updated configuration' message - [^insightcf2.png]
# Return to Jira Custom Field and note the changes there - [^insightcf3.png]

h3. Expected Results
_Reference type_ option reflects the selected reference type

h3. Actual Results
_Reference type_ option shows "All reference types"

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
This does not affect Functionality. If you click to "Return to Jira Customfield" to see the summary of the configuration, it will show the selected Reference Type - correctly
fields.summary: Changes are not reflected in the 'Reference type' option of a Insight Referenced Objects custom field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Creating a "Due Date" hidden field for a Request Type in a Service Desk project while the system language is "English" will lead to customers unable to create requests via the portal if the same has a different personal language(Spanish for example).

The customer will hit into the "Este formulario contiene un campo oculto que no tiene un valor por defecto configurado" error.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the duo date field into a request type.
 # Hide the field choosing a default value.
 # Change your personal language to Spanish
 # Raise a ticket in your service desk project
 # Now, try to create the ticket.

h3. Expected Results

The ticket should be created without an error message.
h3. Actual Results

When creating the ticket, I'm receiving the error message: "Este formulario contiene un campo oculto que no tiene un valor por defecto configurado"
h3. Workaround
 * Change the personal language to English.
 * Configure the duo date field to not be hidden.
fields.summary: Setting Due Date with Spanish Language results in portal requests failed to be created.
